parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Create a dialog which is defined either in the mission's [[description.ext]], in the campaign's description.ext or in the global [[Resource.cpp/bin|resource.cpp]]. The given name has to be the class name used in one of these files. If another dialog is already opened, the desired dialog is created as a child dialog of the one already opened.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''createDialog''' dialogName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> dialogName: [[String]] - class name used in the description.ext / resource.cpp

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] -  
true when the dialog was created successfully
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_ok = [[createDialog]] "RscDisplayGame";
[[if]] (!_ok) [[then]] {[[hint]] "Dialog couldn't be opened!"};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[displayCtrl]], [[createDisplay]], [[closeDialog]], [[dialog]], [[displayNull]], [[controlNull]], [[ctrlCreate]], [[displayParent]]
</value></part></template>



[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.99|CREATEDIALOG]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.96|CREATEDIALOG]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 29, 2017 - 09:04 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">A user dialog created with [[createDisplay]] over mission display ([[findDisplay]] 46) will stop [[displayAddEventHandler|display event handlers]] added to mission display from firing. However if it is created with [[createDialog]] then the event handlers continue to work.
</dd>
</dl>
